alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lincoln, southwestern Ferry and northeastern Grant Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 500 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles south of Nespelem Community, or 50 miles southeast of Omak. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilbur and Bagdad Junction. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 218 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
